reviewText: This is a very relaxing and nicely paced routine. All the excersizes are performed on the floor and include a flat on the back 15-min session and sitting up 15-min session. You can easily do them both together or either one separate. It not a tough routine, very gentle and geared towards those with injuries or just starting with stretching, but I found it also very beneficial as an intermediate yogini. There is a mix of slow movements and stretching. Setting is on a beautiful beach with smoothing instruction and music. Even though this is only a 1/2 hour routine, I will use it again and again on days when I'd like a gentle, short practice. Treat your back to this one !Check my other yoga dvd reviews on amazon.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was so bored with the slow pace of this that I only did it once.  The sound is not that great and the variety of stretches is limited.
summary: Save your money on this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Mimi Solaire is wonderful. She presents healing yoga poses slowly and gives time in between to let the healing begin. She doesn't rush you or challenge you. Just a very good (short) yoga exercise. It is in two parts, each one is 15 minutes. But when I have a sore back that is all I want. It's a little expensive for a 30 minute yoga video. But it is unlike any other yoga video I have experienced. She is a healer.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I get back muscle aches just from everday activities and I wanted a stretching DVD specifically to relax back muscles.  Mimi Solaire's "Back In Shape" offers gentle stretches for the back.  There are two 15-minute sessions and they are filmed on a quiet Australian beach.  The music is soft and fluid, the scenery is serene and calm.  Mimi's voice is soothing and I find this DVD to be very relaxing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A very enjoyable combination of stretches for the back and neck.  One day after "pulling my neck out", I did the stretches and it saved me a trip to the chiropractor.  With chronic neck and back pain it is necessary for me to do regular stretches. I will be adding this to my regular use group of pilates and low impact aerobic workouts to continue managing my pain--I'm pain free as long as I do one of my workouts everyday. I will do this workout on days when I over do it at work or other activities.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Back in Shape is divided into two 15 minute segments with you lying on your back and then, sitting in a chair. I love the relaxing setting on the beautiful pacific ocean and soothing background music. I have been doing the exercises for about 2 weeks and my back feels better after I do the two segments. If you are busy and short on time, this DVD is perfect as it is only half an hour or 15 minutes a segment. The exercises are gentle and easy to do for beginners. I also recommend Peggy Cappy's Back Care Basics DVD as that one is excellent as well.Back in Shape really helps with chronic back pain. I cannot recommend it enough.
summary: Back in Shape - gentle on my back
Title: N/A
